author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I would like to discuss the metric namings, I don't think the proposed names are great

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
The following names are specced
```
get_blobs_requests_blobs_total
get_blobs_requests_blobs_in_blobpool_total
get_blobs_requests_success_total
get_blobs_requests_failure_total
```
I would prefer something like this:
```
engine_getblobs_requested
engine_getblobs_available
engine_getblobs_hit
engine_getblobs_miss
```
which would fit much better into the naming scheme that we have for our metrics, also it describes the actual metric and is less verbose

author: sibkatya
content:
I agree with that but would like to add an `execution` prefix as we categorize metrics into beacon for CL and execution for EL. And add `_total` (for counters) or `_seconds` (for histograms) in the end as recommended by the [prometheus naming standards](https://prometheus.io/docs/practices/naming/)

```
execution_engine_getblobs_requested_total
```
CL metic example:
```
beacon_engine_getBlobsV2_requests_total
```
cc <@1351272205555863614> 

<@412614104222531604> we need a repo for execution metrics specs to standardize them, open issues, discuss, etc.

I also wonder should we make it `beacon_engine_getBlobs_requests_total` and split on V1/V2 using labels? <@1351272205555863614> how do you do this on EL?

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content:
<@360491619402776577> I think your proposed names are more concise and clean. I'd prefer to add `execution_` prefix for clarity between EL/CL as <@564345498471759890> suggested.

<@288990561279541248> and I are happy to implement/integrate the changes accordingly on ELs. We've been working on Geth, Reth, Nethermind, Besu and EthereumJS.

<@564345498471759890> We've been only considering V2 calls. Would it be useful to handle V1 as well?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: The prefix should be added by the ingesting engine, not by the client itself imho

author: sibkatya
content: I tend to agree on V2 only if it doesn't make sense to monitor V1. Would like to hear from <@412614104222531604> and core developers

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content:
Hi all,
We've just resumed our devnet testing from Sunnyside. The report: https://testinprod.notion.site/Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-05-20-1f88fc57f5468034a397d29017942763?pvs=4.
Key findings:
* Reached `~50 blobs/block` repeatedly with Devnet-7 spec with a diverse mix of EL/CL combinations
* Supernodes were unstable at high blob loads - gaining more information regarding this
We will try to identify root causes of the issues we've found in this report and share to the teams. It'd be appreciated if you could have a look, ask questions and give feedback.
